Voici un bière digne de la tradition brassicole belge. Cette triple ronde, équilibrée et élégante sur des saveurs fruités et à lamertume saillante est une belle réussite de la brasserie Saint Feuillien. Avec un final dune plus grande longueur et des arômes sur des variations un peu plus complexes, cette triple aurait fait partie des très grandes bières dabbaye. En verre, belle prestance avec un blond or limpide (EBC aux alentours de 17) surmonté dune mousse crémeuse, abondante de trois centimètres dépaisseur (initialement saffaissant ensuite quelque peu). Son effervescence est marquée avec une multitude de bulles (diamètre moyen). Le nez est dune intensité moyenne, présente, en compléments des arômes de céréales et de coriandre, des notes fruitées prédominantes. Pomme, poire, pêche, citron....une véritable corbeille de fruits! A la dégustation, lattaque est fraîche, la base aromatique sur les céréales est complétée par une amertume déjà présente, des notes citronnées et une pointe épicée de girofle. Très agréable entrée en matière! La deuxième bouche sadoucit et se densifie. La présence du malt se fait plus marquée avec des arômes fruités de pomme, de pêche relevée dune point poivrée. Lamertume se positionne alors parfaitement, donnant de la fraîcheur à la bière avec une arrière bouche restant sur le malt et les fruits jaunes. Lintensité est bien pensée (EBU de 30) et léquilibre avec lalcool (titrage alcoolique de 8,5 % Abv ) et le sucre maîtrisée. La corpulence est quant à elle moyenne mais suffisante (une densité plus dense laurait rendu très certainement écurante). Lensemble se laisse boire très facilement. Le final laisse alors sexprimer davantage la puissance. Celui-ci est cependant toujours bien intégré et laisse se développer des arômes de guenièvre et des notes poivrées. La longueur, acceptable aurait tout de même pu être plus long et plus brillant afin de trancher davantage par rapport à la base de dégustation, plus douce. Mais ne boudons pas notre plaisir, et laissons nous charmer la rondeur des formes de cette belle.

Sadly it trails off a bit quickly. Nice classic tripel flavor, reminiscent of Karmelite. It?s good but I think I preffered the Blonde.

De aspecto muy clásico y fiel al estilo, ámbar pálida y nebulosa. Su espuma es blanquísima y muy compacta. Cuerpo medio y aceitoso y de carbonatación más bien alta.

Su aroma y sabor es simplemente delicioso. Huele a levadura y a muchísima fruta como manzana y melocotón.

En boca es una maravilla. Se entremezclan a la perfección el dulce acaramelado con frutas, especias picantes y el amargor del lúpulo y sin embargo no tienes la sensación de estar bebiendo cerveza compleja, sino limpia y fresca. Hay mucha maestría en sus 33cl.

Su 8,5% ABV se nota mucho más en el aroma que en su sabor. Cuidado que entra demasiado bien.

Bottle from Beer Hawk. NB: I have a cold so taste isnt 100%, may need to re rate this. Aroma of tart apples and flora, pours a semi-cloudy gold with a small white head. Very complex and funky taste with banana, hay, apple and even a very subtle cocoa hit. Very good.

0,33l bottle. Cloudy golden colour with quickly shrinking and medium lasting big foamy white head. Aroma: Light floral notes, butter, ementaler cheese, light leather notes and banana. Taste: Oh my. Fast and shocking were the first impact. Very sweet explosive start with floral, fruity caracters and has a spicey bitter mouthfeel too. I feel a light nutmeg tone. Has a quite champagne feel. Medium body with fizzy carb. Long bitter/sour and floral hoppy finish. A very good tripel, one of theb best you can find.
Láhev, vysoká pěnivost, střední říz, krásná vůně citronové kůry, perfektní belgický triple..

Bottle. Golden color with frothy white head. Aroma has fruits, yeast, hay and earthy aromas. Taste is malty sweet with long balanced aftertaste. Flavors of malt, caramel, fruits like apricot. Also some coriander and hay. Lingering mouth feeling and refreshing taste.
Very good, smooth, yeasty, zesty, estery, all youd expect in a tripel. Highly recommended (25.4 oz bottle, Carrefour Brussels)

bottle from andersons. complex nose is malt and orange rind with some clove and banana ester in there. super smooth for style and balanced, with bready fullness carrying the dark fruit notes that linger a long time. the hints of clove and banana are super mild and mix in well, without jumping over the top. this is great, and may be the only thing better in belgium than the waffles.

Grande blonde translucide avec une belle chevelure blanche épaisse. Nez fruité, sur la fraise, la cerise, lorange, le pamplemousse, le caramel, la marmelade, le miel, lamande, la noisette, labricot, la banane, le citron, le poivre, la céréale chaude, la carotte... Lalcool est bien présent mais équilibré au nez. Un peu de cuir et de bois résineux, voir de cire dabeille... Belle complexité ! La carbonatation est moyenne, lalcool ne dénature pas le tout et la texture est ronde sans être huileuse. Saveurs de malts torréfiés en première intention, amertume qui vient en délicatesse par la suite avec des houblons très aromatiques. Deuxième bouche suave, avec un côté fruité affirmé qui revient sur la fraise, labricot, la figue, le kiwi, la banane... Le palet est bien tenu, cette une bière quon pourrait qualifier de douce tellement elle assouplit lamertume et lalcool. Final sur les céréales, les herbes fraiches et des levures élégantes. Très bonne surprise que cette triple dabbaye. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

Medium body with lively carbonation. Pleasant enough but nothing really special about this one despite the ratings. Personally I would not seek this beer to try and re-live the experience as to me it tastes just like a run-of-the-mill typical Belgium Abbey style beer with no special character or taste, just a very ordinary Abbey Ale.

8.5% gold in colour with a nice head, it had a sweet aroma with a nice strong slightly bitter taste.

Belle robe jaune-orangée avec une mousse blanche fine et dense et une bonne carbonatation.Le nez offre des arômes de houblon, levure,herbes et alcool.Une bonne amertume se fait sentir rapidement en bouche avec un petit "piquant"bien agréable et des notes fruitées.Larrière bouche nous laisse sur une amertume dominante mais bien dosée et un goût puissant bien plaisant et frais.
Bonne Triple!

Robe dorée et mousse blanche abondante et compacte, carbonatation soutenue. 
Nez fruité et citronné avec un soupçon de levure.
Le goût nous amène tout de suite sur les fruits jaunes et des saveurs houblonnées le tout dans une belle harmonie.
La finale est de bonne longueur et amère.
Une bonne triple.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden with big thin white head. Aromas of fruity malt and some spices. Heavy carbonation with a nice body. Taste is first fresh and then bitter. Alcohol is present and mixed with fruity notes and hops. Abbey Tripel is probarly not my favorite style though.

Samean kullankeltainen olut runsaalla valkoisella höttöisellä ja pilvimäisellä suurikuplaisella vaahdolla. Tuoksu belgitripelille ominaisesti viljaisen hedelmäinen, appelsiininen ja sitruksinen sekä aavistuksen mausteinen. Maku belgihiivainen, viljaisen ja hedelmäisen maltainen, hieman mausteinen ja samalla kertaa sekä täyteläinen että raikas. Vahvan hiilihappoinen kokonaisuus. Toimiva tripel, mutta ei kuitenkaan ihan kirkkainta parhaimmistoa.
Mooie tripel. Sterk fruitig aroma met lichte sinaasappelgeur. Dit fruitig aroma komt ook mooi door in de smaak!

Pours a rich golden colour with heavy carbonation resulting in a big white cap, very long lasting and creating some thick foamy lacing. Aromas of fruity malts with spices over mild Belgian yeast. Alcohol is present, but well blended in here. Apples, oranges with the hops for flavours. Decent bitterness from the grassy notes. Hints of honey and gets hazy at the last pour. A nice Tripel with some stronger peppery hops than usual.

Slightly darker than golden, almost transparent. Big fluffy but not very dense head, good enough persistence but not much lacing. Nose displays a dominant estery/fruity profile (candied orange,apricot). Malty/yeasty notes are still there but a bit subdued if compared to most tripels. Taste follows what the aroma suggested, a light per style malty presence (caramel) with strong fruity notes and a hint of spiciness. Finish is dry enough, alcohol is well hidden. Medium to dense body, still a tad lighter than most tripels, good carbonation, again quite in check for the style. Overall a clean, easy and well balanced tripel that lacks a bit in depth

Le liquide, assez corpulent, est poivré, acidulé, effervescent et légèrement amer. Toutes ces particularités forment également un tout qui laisse une belle impression en bouche et en arrière-goût. Cest soyeux, cest malté et cest très appréciable. (MA 03.01.2018) (1876-130716)

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden body, huge white fluffy head with exceptional retention and lots of lacing. Aroma of yeast, grains, apricots, cloves and coriander. Taste of candy sugar, honey, yeast, a touch of spice heat, fruit jam and a hint of alcohol. Exceptional.

Bottle @Strawberry Thief, Bristol.
Medium head, light gold colour, hazy.
Aroma of bananas, fruits, grass, flowers.
Dry and sour taste, with sort of a wit beer aftertaste. Medium body, lively.

A belgian, golden, undiltered Triple abbay ale with high white, creamy head. Aroma is malt, spicy, choriander(?), complex yeasty. Taste is bitter sweet. Pearly.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, wheat, grain, hops and spices.

Appearance:

Hazy golden/amber beer with a medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and wheat; ends slightly dry with grain, hops and spices. 

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but could be a little bit more complex. Definitely a stablel tripel. The dry and spicey hops work great for making you want to take another sip.
the aroma is fruity and malty with hints of citrus, yeast, dry wine and grain... the taste is malty and fruity with notes of banana, dry wine, yeast and flowers... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Nagy, tartós hab, borostyán szín. Illata jellegzetesen tripeles. Ízében a maláta és a komló egyensúlyban érezhető, enyhe, de határozott keserű, markáns fűszeresség, leginkább koriander. Testes, de nem nehéz sör, nagy szénsavtartalommal, de ez mégsem nyomja el az ízeket. Nagyon jó összhanggal rendelkező, finom, jellegzetes tripel.

33cl bottle from LCBO. 8,5 Alc./Vol. Pours an opaque golden colour with two finger of white head. Fruity aroma with notes of bananas, peaches and a whiff of grapefruit. Taste matches the aroma with a creamy texture on the palate and finishes and hoppy. High carbnation. Excellent Tripel. Highly recommended.

Excelente color, se antoja sólo con verla, Se disfruta el aroma, pero es medianamente ligero, la espuma es ligera y breve. Sabor fuerte a alcohol, me recuerda a un buen vino blanco, pero sin la acidez. 
bread, cereal, herbs, dough, alcohol, licorice, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, lively, astringent, bitter,

Jaune clair, le liquide très pétillant est surmonté dune généreuse mousse blanche, cotonneuse et dense. Mi-mince et quasi limpide, elle offre des arômes dabricots et dananas. En bouche, charmantes notes fruitées, coupées par une lame de houblons en fin de gorgée. Alcool absent de la palette gustative. Un savoureux exemple de ce style trop souvent bourré de sucres résiduels ; ici les saveurs sont justes, bien balancées, un excellent exemple de ce type belge épicé et complexe. Peu ou pas de défauts.

Merci à Ju-Lo pour le partage! Un magnifique liquide doré et surmonté dune onctueuse mousse blanche à la durée de vie moyenne. De jolis vestiges sous formes de fines dentelles témoignaient du passage de la mousse. Les houblons européens verts, mentholés et poivrés créent une étrange impression de présence de pepsine, de pepermannes roses. Malts présents et levure Belge abondante. Attaque chaude en bouche attribuable à lalcool agrémentée par un poivre blanc véhiculé par les houblons. Le pepermanne me suit et je ne déteste pas cette impression à la fois fraîche et chaleureuse. Un corps rond parfaitement balance sacoquine parfaitement à la levure gomme balloune typiquement Belge. Houblons sans amertume et pleins de goûts, cette bière mest bien plaisante en cet après-midi de travail.
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 At Rockwell. Very nice stuff, fruity, remarkably easy drinking for the strength, minerally. Malty. Serving: Tap

330ml bottle. Pale golden with a frothy white head and effervescent bubbles. Slight haze. Flavors are yeast, lemon, orange peel, alcohol and minerals with herbal and spicy notes. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, slick texture.

330ml bottle. Pours a pretty big frothy white head and has a slightly hazy golden appearance. Excessive carbonation. Thick patchy lacing. Aromas of Belgian yeast, floral and herbal hops. Flavours are mostly yeasty, toasted malts, floral and citrusy hop notes. Orangey hints as well. Has a nice slight tarty finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Pretty good!

BBD:19/10/2017

Lots of carbonation, very yeasty, bready, banana..not my favorite triple...might need to wait awhile before I open the other.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
A very classic Tripel. Golden. Fruity, spicy and yeasty with banana notes.I like it.

Hazy yellow, big white head. Sharp grassy hop, with good lemon notes, slight funk, and stone fruit. Effervescent mouth feel, and very lively carb. Medium bitterness, yeasty and fruity, very easy drinking. Really nice beer.

ASPETTO: biondo carico, schiuma bianca, fine, abbondante e persistente. AROMA: fruttato (frutta gialla), vaniglia, tanto speziato. GUSTO: allattacco è decisamente fruttata. Bellissime note speziate, con un tocco di caramello. Dolce, ma nello stesso tempo abbastanza equilibrata. Bevuta appagante, ma non la migliore tripel che abbia assaggiato.

Une excellente triple, très légèrement citronnée à lattaque puis une amertume assez prononcée mais pas trop non plus qui donne une belle longueur en bouche. Texture agréable, pas trop pâteuse. Visuellement cest un régal, une belle couleur dorée sans le moindre trouble et une mousse abondante et très blanche. Une référence en triple.

8.5% ABV 
Milton LCBO Outlet #1 (Milton, Ontario, Canada)

The beer pours a hazed straw gold with a half inch foamy snow white cap that lasts throughout. The aroma is honey, yeast, sweet fruits, and grains. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with above-average carbonation. The flavour is sweet malt, light pepper notes, citrus, honey, and yeast.
A nice and clean triple with a ton of yeast presence. Mild citrus and light spice note. Floral and grassy with a heavy body. Nice but a bit uneven.

Dorata leggermente scarica, velata dai lieviti, schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma di miele, polpa d'arancia, leggeri chiodi di garofano, metallica.
Al palato lievito belga, miele, polpa d'arancia e chiodi di garofano, finale erbaceo.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata.
Forse una bottiglia non troppo in forma.

330ml bottle. Pours a pale lightly hazy yellow with a two finger white head. On the nose, lemon peel, white grapefruit juice, mineral notes, yeast, and a light floral note. Taste wise, lightly sweet with mineral notes, wet concrete, light pink grapefruit, a faint sourness, and yeasty notes that head into more citrus in the way of faint lemon juice, some nice sweet underlying malt notes, with lots of citrus and mineral notes in a medium bitter finish. I like it!

2016/05/01 - Pours a hazy, deep gold colour with a soapy, white head that lingers. Aroma is Belgian yeast esters (banana, clove, dough, light bubblegum), sweet bread, herbal and floral hop notes and light citrus (orange, lemon). Taste follows nose and is moderately sweet and bitter; Belgian yeast, banana, clove, sweet dough, candied sugar, light orange/lemon and herbal hops. Mouthfeel is medium with lightly biting carbonation and a dry, slightly sweet finish. Nicely balanced triple.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden colour with lasting white head. Aroma is full of fruity yeast, lemon and herbal hoppiness. Flavour is dry and yeasty with lemon, tart apple/pear, light banana, with herbal, slightly floral hops. Lively carbonation. Subtle alcohol. Quite nice.
330 mL bottle. Nice pour. Dry, fruity, yeasty aroma. Fruitily complex flavour. Low carbonation for the style. Good body. Nice beer.

330ml bottle Head is crisp white and very compact. Lasts throughout. Typical fruitiness and aromatic hops. Subtle hints of banana and lemon. Initial sip reveals a little spice. Dry with a slightly bitter finish. 8.5% abv well balanced with persistent malt. Good representation of the stype

Bottle from LCBO. Clear and mostly clear golden with a large white head. Aroma of dusty lemon, fruity yeast esters, some floral tones. Flavour is full and moderately complex, with some tropical fruit sweetness up front, a touch of banana, herbal hops building in the middle and finish, hint of candied orange. Finish is long and fairly bitter as the beer warms and opens up. Medium weight body that is crisp to start, a little sticky on the back of the palate. Excellent all around.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Mulmur. Hazy pale yellow. Thick head. Soapy lemon yeast aroma. Somewhat skunky first sip. Some barnyard and citrus then I long citrus spice finish.

Ce liquide a un jolie corps jaune pâle transparent. Une bonne effervescence qui vient mettre une fine mousse blanche sur le top! Une odeur de levure 100% belge. Un coté agréablement fruité et malté sous des effluves de miel, bananes, doranges et dépices, tous distinct les uns des autres!

Dès lentrée en bouche, on ressent très bien la levure belge dans un petillement les plus chaleureux. Des bonnes notes de miel et dépices fait ressortir aussitôt son coté fruité de banane, dagrume et dananas. Une finale sèche, douce et soutenu par une petite chaleur dalcool et un petit coté houblonné amer!

Zeer helder lichtgouden bier met massieve witte schuimkraag vol met kleine strakke bubbels.

8.5%ABV. Tripel.

Poured out of the bottle a dirty cloudy yellow amber color. 10ºSRM.

Nose as nice clean light wheaty and malty flavors. Nothing much more beyond that. There is bread dough, whispering about carbs and yeast. There is a clean alcoholic nose as well. I suppose you really shouldnt be asking for more from a well-brewed traditional Belgian tripel. The whole craft beer revolution has brought with it the expectation of something interesting, intriguing or shocking in terms of aroma that we tend to forget the basics and what that means when these foundational principles of brewing are adhered to and produce an ale that really hasnt changed very much in 5 or 6 centuries.

Mouthfeel is aggressively carbonated. This rides on a palate that has all the right malt flavors of graham cracker, wheat toast, barley loaves, caramel with a nice roasty palate of fresh loaves of cracked barley bread. There are bitter hops signaling the end of the palate and encouraging you to take another sip. There is a slightly atypical heaviness to the palate, almost umami, that you definitely dont get off of other tripels like a Karmeliet for example.

Finish is predictaly alcoholic, bitter and brief. There is an aftertaste of what might be considered to be formic acid, the same tangy lightly earthy and claylike flavor note that you get from bitig the butt off a tropical red ant. Slightly longer and more cloying than would be considered proper in todays "craft" palate, but then again, Im pretty sure the fine folks at St Feuillens dont reallly care since what theyre selling is whats been done the same way since forever...

Goes on Favorites List!

 Appearance  The beer is served a amber color with a one finger head of pure white foam. The head fades rather fast, leaving a lighter level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma of the beer is light overall with the heaviest of the smells being that of a yeasty and biscuit like aroma. Along with these aromas are some smells of a more floral and spicy nature with the spice being mainly of a clove and coriander.

Flavors of a more citrus nature come to the tongue as the taste advances with orange and tangerine coming to the tongue.  Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the medium side for a triple with a carbonation level that is on the slightly lower side. A slightly higher carbonation level may have been slightly better for the fruit flavors of the brew, but overall the feel was rather decent for the style.

 Overall  A very easy drinking triple that hides the alcohol very well. Very inoffensive and rather refreshing and quite drinkable in light of its 8.5% abv. Nothing overly exceptional, but still rather enjoyable. A very neutral Belgian triple.

St Feuillen triple, un grand travail de cote parce que la brasserie est une habituée 
des hautes performances... La triple dans ce sens doit occuper une place à part,
puisquelle doit être au faîte de la catégorie des blondes...
Voyons dabord sa force : 8,5 % abv, on est au seuil du bon niveau pour la triple.
Couleur jaune foncé, un peu abricot.
Clarté limpide (quand elle est bue jeune), qui a tendance à devenir voilée avec 
lâge, parce quelle reste très vivante à louverture, et donc la levure se mélange
dans ce cas quelque peu à la bière.
Les bulles sont donc nombreuses et quelquefois en rafale dans le verre.
La mousse blanche est épaisse, aérée dans le verre, crémeuse en haut.
Les arômes sont dorge et de fruits mûrs lorsquelle est jeune, et passent à la date 
et au pruneau plus âgée.
La texture est crémeuse et douce.
La 1ère gorgée donne à la fois des céréales et des épices, avec des notes de girofle,
citron, arrière-bouche sur lorge.
La 2ème donne des notes dabricot et une pointe danis étoilé pour la bière jeune,
qui évolue sur un beau relief céréales/fruits mûrs et figues pour la bière âgée.

Une belle grosse bouteille payée 9.40$.  Je mattarde sur son étiquette et je peux lire que la maison suggère de la consommer avant le 5 avril 2013.  Petit fait cocasse, la vitamine C figure parmi les ingrédients.  Amusant comme tout.  Bon, je termine ce monologue qui ne mène à rien et je mattaque à ce premier verre qui fait très belle figure.  Dans mon fidèle et magnifique verre «Avec les Bons Vux», le liquide dévoile une robe dorée qui est surmontée dune superbe tête blanche.  Une tête mousseuse qui persiste et qui laisse une fine dentelle sur la paroi du verre.  La première chose qui me saute au nez est la très belle présence des épices.  Le girofle me semble bien évident.  Il sinsère ici dans des parfums qui sont explosifs et révélateurs dune très belle complexité : la coriandre et lanis étoilé (五香粉) semblent aussi bien vouloir soffrir avec parcimonie.  Le bouquet fruité qui monte en fines vapeurs est tout aussi intéressant : le nez saiguise sur des fruits tranchants et acidulés.  Quant à la base maltée, elle joue la carte de la bruyante discrétion.  Ni trop fort ni trop faible, le malt se couvre dune fine couche mielleuse qui semble bien connaître son rôle.  Le spectacle continue avec les houblons.  Épicées, mentholées et florales sont autant de caractéristiques qui se collent aux cultivars utilisés dans lélaboration de cette sublime concoction.  Une leçon de maître, véritablement.  Et une fois le pif rassasié, ce sont les papilles qui participent à lévénement.  Des notes citronnées qui attaquent la bouche.  Une présence épicée avec des houblons qui détonnent.  Un blitz contrôlé de notes amères sur la langue.  Des fleurs gigantesques et des herbes.  Une impression en bouche qui est colossale.  Un corps sculptural, féminin, aguichant.  Des bulles qui sont actives, une totale maîtrise du mouvement.  Une texture légèrement huileuse, frivole et accaparante.  Un dernier acte déroutant pour les sens.  Une sonate de houblons et de notes amères.  Une levure qui apporte ses plus beaux moments.  Une grande beauté sans doute capable de réécrire la définition du style.  Pour moi, tout simplement merveilleux.

Flavour has citrus, orange, yeast hints with a moderate sweet at the beginning and a final with an average bitterness with a long duration. Carbonation is lively. Body is medium.

Pale hazy yellow, frothy white head. Very nice nose - malty sweetness, grass, spice, liquorice, caramel and hops. Taste has more grassy liquorice, sweet malt, hoppy bitterness accompanied by caramel. Masks its alcohol very well. Good stuff.

Pale yellow. Cloudy. Big, pure white head. Spritzy citrusy lemon lime aroma. Lemon lime flavor, almost like cleaner.  As it warms :he flavor becomes more bitter and less sweet. Still triple awesome... if you like girly drinks.

Pours a vibrant slightly hazy gold color with a moderate sized white head that leaves no lacing. Nice aromas of tropical fruit and spices. Flavors of citrus, yeast, spices and a very slight alcohol presence. Medium bodied with a dry and sweet finish. A very good beer, this is one of the better beers from this brewery.

On draft at The Common Table.  Pours a muddy yellow with a medium white head.  The aromas are lemon, dough, old closet.  The mouthfeel is sweet and dry with a medium to heavy body and moderate carbonation.   Cheers!

75 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 11.5.2011
Aroma is fruity with some honey and yeast. Flavour has fruits, citrus, hints of spices and yeast. Refreshing and good, the big bottles of this are better.

11.2 oz bottle poured into a goblib

Appearance is a hazy medium gold with a pillowy white head that settles down into a nice cap on top of the beer.

Smell is quite spicy with citrus and bready notes. Lemon is quite predominate along with some yeastyness.

Flavor is quite heavy on the citrus with lemon and perhaps lime. Also somewhat peppery. The yeast is definitely present along with some bready flavors. Really there is a good deal going on. A bit of alcohol becomes noticeable towards the finish.

Overall this is a pretty solid tripel. There is nothing that really stands out but also nothing to detract. Its good all around.

Currently drinking while typing. When the beer is poured you cant help but notice the aroma rising from the glass. Smells of full sweet malt, liquorice, fresh cut grass, sweet herbs and gentle caramels. The beer is amazing to look upon, an amazingly tight creamy and foamy white head that is astonishing and that lasts for what seems an eternity. It sits on top of a fresh golden pearly looking misty beer with lively looking bubbles. Intense flavours of liquorice, malts, sweetness, grassiness, sugars and an amazingly well masked alcohol content. It feels great on the tongue, great carbonation that leaves the beer well balanced, perfect head which stimulates the top lip well and also a full feel in the mouth. Absolutely amazing tripel variety which leaves me astounded everytime I drink one. I would urge anyone to try this gentle but perfect brew, astonishing!
Antydan till raki och den så skumma jästkulturen i doften. Syra och anis är påtagliga i smaken, precis rätt i balansen. Väldigt trevlig.

herbs, spruce, citrus, hay, bread, leather, basement aromas, soy sauce, skunky, ginger, licorice, vanilla, banana, orange, sparkling, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, umami, full body, flat, long finish,

Ar: Rosy, some blackberry and earthiness.
Ap: Slightly hazy straw gold - large rocky white head, good retention, nice thick lacing.
T: Pineapple, rosy alcohol, and grassy up front - medium-high clean bitterness - melon, chalk, and stone-fruit mid-palate - finish is juicy oranges and tropical fruit.
P: Light body with high carbonation - finish is very dry.
O: A masterful tripel - delicious fruit, spice, and earthy flavors - great appearance, and feel on the palate is spot on.
This Belgium Triple poors golden brown with a light head. It tastes sweet and bubbly!
Had on tap at rattle with Annie. Pours a light amber with little head. Taste is slighty citrus with a bite afterwards.
Ruikt fruitig en zoetig.  Smaak idem. Weinig body en weinig spannend. Gemakkelijk te drinken.

33cl bottle. Cloudy yellow colour. Huge white head. Aromas of Apple, citrus and yeast. Taste: white grapes and citrus, like a sweet white wine. Then the bitterness, yeast and spices turn in. Finish is bitter and long with some pepper. Medium body.
Wow, Very good tripel. Fruity and spicey

Hazy and golden with a fluffy off-white head and some decent lacing. Aroma of bubblegum, spice, citrus, flowers, and pear. Taste is nicely hopped, slightly sweet and the yeast and fruit shine. Medium bodied and a touch fizzy. Good stuff.

Golden cloudy body with a big white head. Aroma is yeasty, floral, somewhat soapy and fruity, with some cereal and a green apple note. Medium palate with nice carbonation. Nice balanced flavour, with a fruity sweetness along with a subtle spicy mustiness. A very nice and interesting tripel.

I could be biased, cause I love almost any Belgian tripel, and this met my standards nicely. Thick rich malty flavour without being overwhelming before the fruitiness comes in and settles on the palate. Real nice and one of the best beers Ive had lately.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2012 Aroma is complex met licht citrus-fruit, maar ook zoet- en aarde-achtige noten. Smaak neigt naar karamel, maar fris fruit (peer, druif, mandarijn) voert de boventoon, de afdronk is aardig, beetje kruidig (basilicum...). Snel dalende kraag. #2 Prima triple; zelfde rating, minder karamel geproefd, rest zoals #1. Kraag blijft ook goed op, mooi stevig.

750mL bottle, split 3 ways, pours a cloudy golden yellow with a big white head. Aroma is big on champagne yeast, barnyard funk, and subtle dry apple - exactly how I like my tripels. Flavour is dry and funky, with lots of yeast, some dry vinous (white wine) notes, lots of barnyard funk, and spices, with a yeasty, spicy finish. Delicious tripel.

33 cl. bottle into a trappist glass. Hazy, light amber colour with a big, white foamy head, that fades to a cap and leaves some nice lacework. Sweet and hoppy aroma with lots of fruits and yeasts. Light pepper notes. Sweet  taste with lots of fruits and spices. Thick texture. Full bodied with a lively carbonation. Long lasting finish with lots of fruits, yeast and a pleasant burn on the palate. Excellent triple!
Bready/yeasty in aroma with a mild spice note.  The flavor is yeasty with a decent dose of bread and spice, with a decent malty base to it.  Good tripel, not overly spicy with a good maltiness.
Nice head, cloudy golden. Fat nose with bacon and grains, dryness. Fullbodied with some length. Highly carbonated with some sweet fruitiness, candis and sugar.

Nr. 1229
Fruchiges Aroma nach Mandarine und Melone, dazu leicht hefig. Erfrischender Antrunk, hefiger Start, wird in der Mitte ganz intensiv fruchtig, ohne zu saeuerlich zu sein. Im langen Abgang wird es leicht bitter und würzig. Ein absolut leckeres Tripel, dass in Erinnerung bleibt.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2013 33cl bottle. Served in the original glass. Yellow/orange and a bit hazy with a good white head. Nose : Pear and peach aromas. Little cherry and banana. Alcohol. Yeasty. Sip : Full body with a deep foamy carbonation. Sour and dry from the start. Lemon zest with pear, cherry and peach aromas. Ending with a hoppy bitterness. Great discovery.

average rocky frothy white head. gl. md. translucent average density dark yellow body. aroma: caramel, light hoppy, flowers, orange, alcohol. if: light sweet moderate bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. deliciosos dulçor e amargor remetendo a laranja, tripel balanceada, honesta, esconde o teor alcoolico com maestria, cerveja muito caprichada, deliciosa150s
Clear goldblond coloured beer with small white head and no carbonation. Hopped sweet aroma with some chewing gum hints. Full sparkling palate. Finish is soft hoppy. Soft triple with some sweet hints.

750ml bottler to snifter. Pours pale golden yellow with a large foamy white head that settles to a whispy film a sudsey collar. Aroma is citrus rind and spice with a yeasty scent. Taste is more citrus rind and yeast with spices and a biiter warm finish. Palate is medium and very fizzy with a dry warming alcohol finish.
Light given the alcohol content. Light aroma, but with a citrus and spice in the flavor. Full bodied with a tapering finish. Bold but good.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 Golden fizzy body with white foamy head. Not necessarily tasty looking. Very yeasty, some pear. Sharp tones from the bubbles. Dry and dusty taste. Sounds bad but it somehow works. Still needs some fruit. (33cl bottle, 2,30 EUR)
Very tasty and enjoyable Tripel. Sweet and fruity aroma, well balanced bitterness.

A good tripel and a good example of this style of beer. This is one of those good brews to have as a dessert or it also makes for a nice, warming nightcap! Good complex flavors help this one make for a very tasty brew. If you have not tried a tripel before I would recommend starting with one of these and then explore other tripels in order to find your favorites!
Draft at Blue monk. Honey golden pour. Bubblegum, sweet malts, herbal honey in both the flavor & aroma. Definately a sweeter tripel, pretty flavorful with a drier finish

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2012 Hazy blond, white head. Nose of dandelious and honey. Full bodied with oily texture. Hops with hints of almonds and quina create an uniqe bitter palate. Long and pleasant overhelming bitter finish. Excellent! Hazy orange with a big off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. Refreshing. 240110
Pours a hazy orangish golden with a slight white head.  Aroma has a yeasty funkiness with some fruit.  Flavor is spicey, fruity, and a bit of earthiness.
Nice and white frothed head.  Light spice and yeasty aroma with hints of yellow fruits.  Flavors match well and more fruit comes out on the palate.  Sweeter spice hopped finish, nice lingering.

A hazy orange beer with a huge beige head. The aroma is sweet spicy with notes of coriander, gooseberries, yeast, and citrus. The flavor is very sweet, but not too much, since it is combined with loads of different spices; coriander, orangepeel, yeast, earth, and wood. In the background lies a acidity - that balances the sweetness perfectly.

St. Feuillien
Tripel
Pours straw yellow with a thick pillowy head and good retention. Aroma has a sharp yeasty funk with lots of cloves and a nice floral note. Flavor carries a light fruitiness with yeasty funk and a mild spice note. Mildly sour at the finish, but overall a fairly solid brew.

Cloudy light gold, pleasing aroma of citrus, wheat, Belgian yeast spiciness on the nose. It almost smelled like cheese on first whiff.  Perhaps a touch of apricot as well. Taste was pleasing, peppery light fruits tones. Belgian spice and funk apparent but not overwhelming. Dry finish. Great little tripel, hitting all the right notes.

Bottle 330ml. from Swords. Rich and "yeasty". Aromas of bread, citrus, grain, and sweat. The taste has a sweet start, with acidic notes, and bitterness taking over for a long and dry finish. Palate is velvety, and highly carbonated, with full body. Dark yellow, with a frothy head.
Cloudy amber with a thick creamy white head. Bitter fruit flavour with that warming effect you expect from a beer of this strength. Good beer.

Cloudy amber coloured with medium-thick head. Smell of coriander and mint. Aroma of citrus and a faint of honey. Soft carbonation, long finish. Medium sweetness and light sourness. A fresh summer beer despite the 8,5 %.

Pours a one finger white head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving traces of lace. Good carbonation and medium bodied.  Hazy, pale amber color.  Nose is tart fruit and flavor is tart fruit with some sweetness from the malt. Clean finish, higher ABV is hidden. Pricey at $5.70 for a 330ml bottle from Colonial Spirits, Acton, MA.

Pours golden color with pure white, frothy head.  Very carbonated with great head retention.  Aroma is of fruit, herbs, and alcohol.  Taste is quick malt followed by herbal (spices-clove) and dry finish

I suppose this style will always be a big hit or miss for me.  This ones pretty good.  Orange, cloudy, at least some head.  Very fruity indeed.  Mostly of cherries or some other dark fruit.  It lingers and fades to a bittery fruit.  But its not too dense and almost refreshing during a Texas summer.  The abv is scary.
Pretty standard tripel color. Smell and taste pretty good. Really nice carbonation, well balanced.
Pours with a thick head, ambar colour. Orange with some alcohol  aroma, Taste is sweet, with some orange also. Nice triple
Very nice abbey tripel. A bit candy like but not too much though. Nothing really wrong with it.
Nice smooth abbey tripel with an interesting hoppy flavour. Slight flavour of medicine in there.
Light hazy golden pour. Small head. Candy malt and yeasty fruity nose. Cereal Malts. light-medium body. Dry finish, Nice,

Pretty good pour; bubbles a bit more diffuse, and not too sticky (dies down after a minute or so). Nice, spicy, peppery aroma. Huge and full. Nice, balanced mouthfeel, thickness-wise; pretty bouncy/effervescent otherwise. This might be the textbook tripel.

Well the Feuillien Dubbel may have been a miss, but the Tripel was squarely on target. Tastey,creamy, but not overly fat or filling. Great bouquet of flowers, spice, and heavenly fruit. Could smell this all day long. Tastes purty good too.
Servida en Les 4 Pedres (Badalona). Una muy buena tripel. Muy suave, cero amarga.

Bottle @ home. Hazy, burntish orange appearance with a foamy off white head. Very yeasty, bready, lightly citrusy, Belgian ale nose. Yeasty, a touch bitter, fairly strong Belgian golden ale flavor with some spiciness and breadiness. Spicy, yeasty aftertaste. This bottle may be a little dated but Ive honestly never been very impressed with this beer.

Bottle 33 cl. Slightly hazy golden pour, with a large white and very durable head. Aroma of malt, yeast, hops and mild spices. The taste is fairly sweet malt and fruit and spice. Creamy mouthfeel afbalenceret nice aftertaste.

Bottle. Without yeast pours a light golden yellow with a medium, airy head. With yeast a hazy amber with a large thick head. Aroma is sweet banana, spiciness, cloves, apricots. With yeast in comes the Belgian yeast aroma as well as some pungency. Banana aroma is weaker. Taste is strongly spicy with notes of cloves and bananas. At the end comes a stingy mixture of spiciness and alcohol. With yeast, the stinginess is very much smoothed out and brings in its own flavor. Banana disappears again. Palate is medium and fairly carbonated.

33 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy amber beer with a disappearing white head. Aroma: Floral, mint, weak malt. Taste: Medium sweetness, some bitterness. Palate: Nearly medium body, above average carbonation.
Pale clear yellow. Medium head and body. Fresh citrus-fruit blended with green fresh cut grass and a faint alcoholic dough. Soft dry-bitter finish. An okay multinational  brew.

bottle.  Pours pale, cloudy gold with big white head into trappist glass which ultimately is sustaining as a thin layer.  Aroma is somewhat milder than I expected, although quite pleasant, with flowers like tulip and with light honey, also sweet apple / pear and a touch of wheat.  Medium bodied, smooth, pretty refreshing, with medium carbonation.  Notes of apricot in the flavor and light spices, apple, honeysuckle.  The finish does impart a subtle, hopped bitterness along with a light yeasty / breadyness.  Overall a very nice, dangerously drinkable triple, quite enjoyable.

Draught @ Malja, Kuopio

Pours light orange with a foamy head. Aroma has hints of fruits. Taste is quite nice with hints of spices and fruits. Nice smooth finish and alcohol warms nicely.

Appearance:  rich medium gold, creamy one-finger white head, thick lacing.  Aroma:  champagne, yeast, honey, fresh-baked white bread, clove, white grapes.  Taste:  yeast, cloves, white pepper, sparkling apple cider, a little ginger, wheat crackers.  Finish:  smooth, dry and yeasty.  Notes:  Palate was a wonderful combination of smooth creaminess offset by extremely lively carbonation.  Flavors were excellent and typical of the style, but the palate was really what set this one apart for me.

Pours blonde and transparent with a big, foamy white head. Nose is fairly modest for the style, with sweet bread, yeast, alcohol, and slight citrus blending together. Flavor is much spicier and the sharp carbonation really jumps out; malt goes from oranges to candied sugar and bread, front the back. Theres no shortage of coriander here. The front has a bit of sourness to it-not unlike a saison-but it fades back to usual tripel territory fast. Finish is long and clean for the malt load. Excellent tripel.

Woohoo! Very nice tripel. This is something I really can enjoy. Full deep round body and all the flavours are well in balance. resin, citrus, alcohol, amber, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, normal finish but a bit sour.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 (330ML Bottle.)  From 750mls . Perfume covered esters (apple.pear.banana.)wheat covered with spices which Im too amateur to pin point . Huge ass big white head above blonde beer with lively carbonation. Its soft but also robust on the palate @ once.  Everything mentioned in the aroma is in the flavour range but there is a yogurt texture and its creamy ,dry and citric choppy too! Ive loved this for years. Its effervescent and that might sound wanky but fuck u! By far my fave Triple.

Pours a cloudy straw (dont know why amber was mentioned down below, never saw an amber triple yet). Huge white head that falls very quickly. No lacing left on glass.
Smells of spices and alcohol. Lot of alcohol in the nose. And the spice from a couple sniffs smells of anise. Almost like someone slipped some absinthe into my beer glass.
Little bit of the absinthe flavor up front, to include the alcohol content taste. A little peppery and maybe some coriander taste. When I first started drinking it it was mostly pepper I was tasting, now its the licorice/absinthe flavor finished off by the alcohol.
Coats the tongue with a slick oil like substance that seems to remind you that you just drank absinthe, except you didnt. And the alcohol kind of thins it out a bit. And its not that strong. Its not bad though, just strange.
Not horrible, but I definitely could only drink this one. Maybe if I didnt let it warm up over the course of 20 minutes it would have fared better. I might come back to this one again, but there are way too many beers to drink over here.
Golden with a frothy white head. Good spicy aroma. High carbonation. Good taste, with touch of orange.
Typical Belgian triple, fruity aromas, very fruity yeasty body, light hops,  belgian malt body, long lingering finish
Hyper Carbonated, but flavorful and refreshing. A solid Tripel, I am consistently impressed by the style.

Celebrator 23rd Anniversary party 2011 from the bottle. It pours yellow with a big white head. The aroma is grainy and yeasty with over ripe fruit. The flavor is again very yeasty and complex with lots of fruit and touches of lemons and tangerines. Theres hints of grains and cardboard in the finish. Im not sure of the age of the bottle.
2011 - 02 - 05 750 ml bottle. yellow colour. lots of carbonation. big white head. smooth taste for a tripel, most tripels ar to sharp for my liking, but this one is pretty okay

Rating #496, bottle at my sisters birthday, bought in Netto, Nakskov  

A hazy yellow beer with a nice head. Aroma is flowery hops, yeast and peach. Flavors are delicious peach, flowery hops, yeast, light alcohol. A simple, but good tripel with a nice fruity touch. Easily thick and creamy palate.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2011 Thanks to Homerwantsbeer for sharing a bottle. The beer is a hazy yellow color with a medium thin white head and lively carbonation. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of yeast, apricots and malt. Medium body with flavors of fruit, yeast, floral hops and malt. The finish is sweet and fruity with yeast lingering afterward. Above average overall.

Shared bottle, thanks to Sigmund who provided this one. Pours cloudy golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma is typical for a trappist, yeasty and spicy with a sweet malty base, this is as it tastes as well. Fruity orange and pepper. Lively carbonated. Medium bodied. Nice dry end.

Had a bottle of this at a Belgian restaurant.  I must say that I am totally getting to like good tripels!  A good tripel is a great tipple.  Attractive light pour with a decent head.  Orange blossoms and floral hops in the aroma.  A lightly bitter tripel, with a bit of orange and caramel.  Nicely balanced and blended - very good!

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a medium sized, foamy off-white head. Lively carbonation. Nose of light malt, coriander with yeast notes. Sweet flavour with spices, orange and yeast. Medium bodied. Slightly bitter finish. An OK classic triple.

6 liter bottle:
2 finger white foamy head, disappears slowly.
Very very light cloudy orange beer.
Smell yeast, malts, fruit, orange, tangerine, spices, cloves, light woody and sugary.
Taste some smooth balanced yellow, orange and red fruit, spices, light peppery, cloves, malts, bitter, yeast and light sweet and a light hint of cough medicine.
Low to mid carbo, mid body and soft mouthfeel. Well balanced.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Bottle: a six litre one... Pours a light orange body with a typical rich Belgian head. 
Modestly sweet aroma, dry yellow fruit, cloves. Taste is dry, sweetish, yeast. Quite balanced.

33cl. bottle. Pours a translucent gold with a fizzy white head. Potent (but light, not thick) aroma with crisp spice and yeast. Very balanced flavors -- elements of yeast, spice, and coriander with no significant banana taste. Has a light body for the alcohol percentage and the fine carbonation provides for a crispness of palate. Hides alcohol very well. Aftertaste has just a hint of chai spice.
21st April 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Well carbonated fruity beer. Aromatic malt. Marmaladey finish. Nice.
Dejlig tripel med flot skumkrone , behagelig blød , maltet smag også i eftersmagen.. grumset...
Bottle 33 cl. Poured golden colour with huge white head. Aroma is fruits and spices. Flavour is some kind of sweet fruit and yeast. Dry and monotounos.
Bottle. Golden with medium white head. Flavour is malt, sweet, hops, fruit and spices.

21-DEC-2010, bottle @home, from "Netto".
Light golden, slightly hazy with a huge white head.
Nice yeasty nose with yellow exotic fruits. Taste is the same fine fruit, pineapple and mango, but also some alcohol. Ending with a watery bitter twist. High carbonation with fine bubbles.
Overall an OK triple.

33cl bottle. Clear gold, thick white head. Muted tropical-fruit bouquet with moderate peppery phenols. In the mouth, candy sugar, followed by lots of pineapple & tropical fruit, rinsing to a peppery, dry finish. Revising each sip downward in overall impression. Not a fave.

330ml bottle. pours light golden with a thick white head that lasts forever. aroma is spicy, with a notable hops presence. taste starts off with notes of bread and cereal, then lingers into fruits and spices, and ends with bitter hops. full bodied and medium carbonation. a lovely beer.
Nose is elderflower, sweet grape, late yeast, feel is watery, carb is broad, taste is sweet apples, late weak bitter hops
A strong a falvoured beer. Subtle aromas of hops, fruits, spices and flowers. Lively carbonation. Definitely one of my favourite beer, with the Tripel Karmeliet.
