Hazy golden with big white head. Sweet yeasty aroma with orange peel, coriander and other spices. Sweet malty flavor with oranges ueast and coriander. Finishes dry. Good tripel.

Bottle. Yeasty, Belgian spicey aromas. Fruits, including banana. Darkish golden color with a finely bubbled white head. Medium body with creamy/fizzy carbonation. The flavor starts fruity, and banana is present. Seems to have clove. There are a lot of things here. The finish is somewhat astringent, and the spices and hop (floral?) leave the mouth tingling. It is just really good ale.

750mL cork and caged bottle poured into chalice.

Wonderful golden color with a pillowy white head that retreated and left a solid lacing. Yeasty, clove, banana, and other spices make up the aroma. Taste has a fruitiness to it with banana and clove, very good, almost perfectly put together. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Very drinkable, not one I would have very often, but is great when I do have it.

Bottle, 33 cl. Taste this beer for the 4th
time.
Hazy golden to orange color, with white head.
Aroma bit spice, fruity, hops. Medium body.
Taste is complex, notes of pepper, malts, hops, good bitterness, bit dry end.
Very nice tripel.

(Bottle, Monks Café, Stockholm) Golden orange colour with brief, white head. Malty, fruity nose with mellow, but distinct, notes of orange and apricots, lots of orange peel. Fruity, fiery taste with notes of orange, apricots and spices with a soft, pleasant fire burning through a warming finish. Lovely balance, very nice beer. Essentially what a triple should be like.
750ml bottle.  Beer poured a burnt orange color with a thin creamy head.  Aroma was bitter sweet with hints of citrus fruits, pine and some spice.  This was a very good tripel.
Floral e frutada, mas um pouco fraca e sem complexidade pro meu gosto. Paladar de frutas cristalizadas, mas sem a intensidade que se espera de uma Tripal.

Nice light orange color with a nice head.  Very smooth taste with average finish that satisfies the taste buds.  Alcohol content does not make to much of a taste difference, even with the high content.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Hazy orange colour. Bursting head. Sweet nose. Hoppy with fruit flavours throughout. Honey as well, even cinnamon. Quite sweet. Spicy too. Really nice. Smooth. Alcohol flavour hidden until end. Roasty finish. Gets better as it warms up.
Woody aroma.  Very clear and light colored.    Nice dry finish.  A little bit one dimensional, but that would really make this one go well with a meal or some cheese.  A great tripel all in all.

Garrafa. Coloração dourada turva com creme branco consistente e persistente. Floral e frutada. Carbonatação média. Amargor leve. Cerveja suave, com boa drinkability. Fermento. Faltou um pouco de complexidade e de personalidade. Suave demais para uma tripel.
yellowish gold appearance with a medium head.  flavor is yeasty and oakey with moderate carbonation.  a nice tripel

Pours hazy golden with an enormous, thick, very long lasting head that laces wonderfully.  Nose of honey, cinnamon, cardamom, alcohol, pear.  Honey and apricot  and cinnamon dominate the flavor, with yeasty bread dough and some hops spiciness.  Nice alcohol warming.  Oily, creamy mouthfeel.  Quite sweet.  Good

Magnum bottle(s). Huge lasting white head, little cloudy appearance. Plenty of spices, yeastiness, quite pungent, but rather complex and enjoyable. Very dry finish, after a little sweety warming and a bit prickly palate. Balanced. Powerful. Dangerous.

2 ounce sample at 99 Bottles, Federal Way, WA.  White head.  Little lacing.  Mostly clear body.  Melted butter color.  Major aromas and flavors include lemon, pear, grape, cloves, other spices.  Primary flavor is grape-pear with hint of lemon.  Less dry, more sweet, than the other tripels I have had.  Great.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with large creamy white mostly lasting head. Fruity aroma. Sweet spicy flavor with notes of alcohol-

Bottle: Pours a hazy deep golden topped by a dense, white, frothy head. The aroma has some nice sweet Belgian malts, sweet and spicy simultaneously. Honey-ish, with a date like fruitiness. Lively, rich mouth feel. Has a nice Belgian malt profile, giving it a solid body. Flavor is honey-ish, figgy, yeasty, and has a sweet nutty character as well, with a balancing spiciness. The finish has an ideal amount of bitterness to make this treat highly quaff-able. A rich, and very appetizing Tripel.

Pours clear and golden with large white head. Sweat and spicy aroma. Plenty of malts in the smell. More spiciness in the flavor. Well balanced. I could imagine drinking this all day ong and having a great time getting aquainted with the floor.
A big blonde beer with honeyed overtones and therefore sweet in a pleasant, moderate way. Quite a tasty treat and above-average.

6 liter bottle enjoyed at Pre-GABF party.  Yellow onion pour that was clear with plenty of carbonation and a huge head.  Musty sweet floral aroma.  The flavor has flowers and a generally easy drinking Belgian yeast profile that is marked with some light spice (kind of like cardamom).  Yeasty dark fruit 9like prune).  Tasty.  Medium creamy carbonated body.
A very nice tripel, this one pours a clear, medium gold.  Nose is yeast and spices.  Flavors are the same, with notes of light fruit, and full.
750 BOTTLE. I really expected more from this beer. Way too much carbonation. Strong taste of yeast and alcohol. Does start off smooth and finishes strong. Liked it, but have had better Tripels.

330ml bottle. Amber coloured with a decent off-white head. Aroma of caramel,  spice and hay. Flavour started sweet before hints of coriander and cloves. The finish was easy with a touch of alcohol. Enjoyable.

bottle. Amber with off white head, moderate lacing. Slightly sour aroma, nice balance of hops and malt, yeast, fruits.  Not as sweet as I would have expected. Quite drinkable, but more subtle than exciting.

Pours a hazy honey color with an off white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, spices, some banana and slight alcohol. Maybe a hint of shaving cream in the aroma. Smooth and somewhat creamy with a velvety texture. Flavor is belgian yeast, some spices, slight banana, and some other sweet fruits. Medium to thin body.
The aroma is sweet with alcohol, malt, yeast, and spice.The appearance is dark gold with an average head. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is thin. Overall a good beer.
A truly solid triple. with great flavors of wood,  fruit and malt, the alcohol comes through at the end and the hops are very mild. however it is very smooth. Worth your time and money

Pours a hazed gold with almost no head out of a 330 ml bottle. Nose is typical: yeast and sugar. Though the sugar is only a minor edge. Flavor is crisp with a slight bitter edge to a larger sweet profile. Kind of tangy a bit in the back of the mouth too. Feel is very high on bubble. A big effervescence in the back of the mouth. Drinkable, yes. It is a smooth tripel. Yet it does not have much outstanding character to speak of. Decent, but no home run.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2011 Flaske. Min ubetinget trippel so far. Frisk og rund. Let bitterhed i eftersmagen men det er med i friskheden. Egentlig bar en nydelse i en af mine absolutte favorit genrer.
Re-rate: Et nyk op. Dette er blevet min go-to beer, aldrig skuffende og oftest mindblowing.

750, corked and caged. Pours a gorgeous crystal clear medium straw with fast-rising streams of bubbles and a towering, sudsy, platinum blonde head. Gorgeously nuanced nose of honey, grass, hay, and floral notes. Nice steady webs of lacing. Medium-bodied, fizzy-carbed attack, with sweet flavors swirling up right off the get-go. Elegantly modulated mid-palate with gentle sedimentary layers of all the sweet notes from the nose reprised, combined with a nicely considered herbal hop note for the finish. Proof positive that acres of sugar do not a tripel make.

750 ml bottle. An unclear blonde beer with a big, white and persistent head. Spicy and grassy aroma with some notes of orange peel. Also the flavour is spicy with coriander and orange peel and the sweetness is well balanced. Strong body, spicy aftertaste. A truly good beer and dangerously drinkable.

Clear gold with nice white frothy head, great lacing.  Yeasty citrus spice aromas whisp off the brew as well as wheat, apples and other quiet fruits.  The taste itself is light, bready and yeasty, but has spicey clovey and floral fruit overtones as well as a firm hop presence and subtle citrus notes.  A well balanced and well constructed tripel.

330ml bottle from a Fine Food store at Kastrup Airport. Light orange body, slightly unclear, under a white, whipped egg foam. Sweet smell of fruits and flowers. A candy sweet character also brings flavours of cloves and yeast backed by a touch of liquorice. Soft palate and hidden alcohol. Too much sweetness to make a better score (at home, 07.08.2007).

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2008 Excellent Tripel, by far one of the best around. Aroma is hoppy - slightly citrus and spicy. Taste is hoppy and bitter, but powerful and smooth. A proper Tripel, not overly spiced and not sweet, right in there with hop ascendency.The beers are notably different with the corked 750, 1500 or 3000 ml etc bottles brewed at Le Roeulx being far suprior,but I believe the all of Tripelis is brewed here. Superb.

golden pour w/ a thick small bubbled white head, thick carbonation, light visible carbonation.  Aroma of white pepper very floral hops, lots of yeast characters some odd spices I cant identify reminds me a little of a chimay blue from memmory of course some bread as well.  Palate is well coated and full.  Flavor is very nice typical belgian yeasts, some clove bread, very sweet candied sugars, some complex spiced yeast notes.  Very nice.

Bottle. Thanks to Santa. Pours a golden body with nice head. Aroma is pleasant, yeasty, rich smell, slightly musty. Flavor was smooth, nicely balanced, light citrus caramel laying in the back. Very enjoyable.

Pale yellow brew with foamy head and lots of carbonation present. Strong hops presence in the aroma and notes of heavy syrup. Warming malty flavor, big warmth. Bit of a cough medicine undertone. Very unique aftertaste and palate. Not bad, just different. Strong warmth spreading through the head and a deep burn in the chest.

Bottle 0,75L. Brown/red clear sparkling colur, with a huge creamy head.
Aroma is lots dark chocolate,dust,yeast,fruity,citric. Flavor is smouth malty,dark choclate, and a touch of mild coffee,medium body.Fruity medium finish. A werry nice Abby tripel this one.

33 cl bottle in (wet, rinsed) Westmalle glass.  Pours bright golden color with lasting white head.  Mild aroma of Lemon Poppyseed Cliff Bar.   Mild sweet fruity start with awesome spicy dry finish.  Medium body, medium-high carbonation.  Really excellent.  One of the better triples IMHO.

Poured a hazy soft amber with a thick creamy off white head. The aroma was sweet, definitely belgian, a tad sour, not as much spice as I would have liked. the flavor was dry, a bit spicy, slight belgian taste, sweet. The palate was dry and musty. A pretty good tripel but nothing extraordinary.

The color was a peachy/orange.  The head was creamy, frothy, and off-white.  The aroma was hoppy, sweet, grainy, and yeasty.  The flavor had a bite to it.  It was earthy, grainy, yeasty, and hoppy.  The palate was smooth and the finish, yeasty.
gold blond coloured body with a average white heada fruity aroma  a malty and fruity taste and a bitter and fruity finich
33cL bottle.  Surpisingly complex tripel.  Good carbonation with a hazy straw color.  Perfect amount of fruity sweetness than is not overpowering.

Tap at Barley Johns.  Golden and somewhat milky appearance.  Crisp and sweet green apple aroma.  Hints of almond crème frosting and a sharp tequila accent this at times.  Apples also dominate the taste with a tart, slightly sugary affectation.  Mild suggestions of sweet pistachios and cashews temper it a bit, but for the most part the green fruit is the single dimension.  Palate lacks spark and dials in somewhat outside of the style  bored, slick, and a bit heavy.  Its lost some of its life.  Slightly trite, but a reasonable quencher.
Bottle. Hazy and yellowish in colour with a rather large white head. Fruity and somewaht artificial - so so sweet.

33 cl. bottle.  Cloudy amber/orange with a thin head.  Aroma of butter cookie malt along with floral hops, pear, white grape, and some musty hay.  Off-sweet biscuit malt flavor with a nicely balanced underpinning of fruity esters, spice and citrusy hops.  Pretty good tripel.

One of the better tripels I have had in a long time.  It is traditional, and not overwhelmed by alcohol or strange spices.  The aroma has wheat and citrus, as well as Belgian yeast and malt.  Flavor has more of the smae, some coriander as well, sweetness that has the flavor of fruit.  Gold color and cloudy.

On tap at the Sharp Edge Bistro. I am very glad to have had the chance to taste this stuff. Pour is very similar to the appearance of ubiquitous pale yellow american lager. Perhaps a little hazy, but just barely. Constant micro bubbles rising within tho the initial palate is rather flat. Aroma is gentle sweet flowers with a hint of candy. Taste this and your mouth gets coated on the inside. There is a warm feeling all over. Very refined. The alky content is not readily apparent but it is there. There is an initial slight alky hit but that is immediately taken over by the sweet complexities of this brew. These hgih class brews really put the micro brews to shame. Comes across a little winelike, but civilized. Nice lacing. Never know this was a trippel, smooth and easy to drink. Each sip gives you a gentle love tap nudge on the shoulder that this is +8%. Then it goes away and hides. Finish again is winelike but the alky nudge is gone before you swallow.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Thanks to retro42 for sharing.  Hezy yellow beer with a faint white head.  Spicy with faint sourness to it.  Wheaty body with body with spice and plenty of yeast.

From a 750ml bottle, shared by akevitt, pours a clear golden brew with a heavy bubbly white head that leave a good lacing. Aroma of barnyard yeast, flowery hops, some orange peel and some phenol. Taste is medium bodied, carbonated with flavors of apple, apricots and some peppery spice. Finish has some spice with yeast and alcohol warmth.
Bottle (Per) at The Club !! Cloudy yellow - white head. Sweetness, honey, wheat, light licorice, yeasty, far too sweet. Boring.

Bottle trappist glass. Pours a nice coudy orange color with a large white head, that lasts nicely. Large orange peel aroma, with some dry bread notes and a touch of spice. Taste is nice large, with fruit and spice but finishes dry. Nicely dry, not as fruity as many triples nor as strong of a yeast prescence. I dig this triple.
bottle. yellow color. large head. sweet aroma. also sweet taste of triple. a bit too artificial. but otherwise a normal triple.

Pours light amber with two finger head that dissipated slowly.  Poured into chalice glass.  Cloudy. I smell coriander.  Slightly spicy, coriander flavor with perhaps some cherry.  Yeasty, medium bodied.   Highly effervescent.  Not bad, not great....something in between.

750ml corked bottle. Light golden color with white head. Aromas of light sugary-sweet fruit, peachy, with undertones of hay, yeast, and metal. Flavor is nicely balanced and follows the aroma, with sweet fruit cut by drying carbonation and yeast bite. The fruit really comes through nicely at room temperature. Goes swell with some Harry Belafonte on the hi fi.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of coriander, yeast, fruit and malt.

Sampled from a 750ml bottle.  Hazy and golden hued.  White head.  Floral and perfumy nose with a touch earthiness.  Medium to full bodied.  Smooth and easy.  Sticky honey notes.  Floral and lively.  Very easy drinking.
Robe blonde légèrement voilée surmontée dune mousse blanche qui sestompe. Arômes dalcool, de céréales et de houblon aromatique. Saveurs de céréales, de houblon aromatique, dagrumes et de levures.

Bottle. Clear golden colour, lots of bubbles and a huge white head. Fruity and spiced aroma with quite a bit of coriander, yeast and a hint of oranges. Sweet malty flavours with good fruit, mainly oranges, as well as dry yeastiness. Fizzy. A nice trippel as you would expect from this brewery.

75 cL bottle. Pours yellow to orange hazy with a huge off-white head, in fact I had a hard time pouring this one. Aroma is sweet malt, coriander, clear notes of yeast, floral and citric. Flavour is spicy, orange, yeast and sweet. Sweet, spiced and bitter finish.

Clear golden with a white head. Yeasty, sweet nose, tiny hints of phenol. Spicy, quite sweet with honey and some phenolic notes, a bit orangey as well. Overly carbonated, but leaves a nice, dry finish.

An off bottle? Certainly an okay Tripel, but it is missing something, or maybe has too much of something, namely carbonation. Yes, it is to be expected but this leans towards soda pop. Otherwise a fruity, yeasty above average drink.

This is a very nice beer.  The first thing I thought when I had this was that it tastes like a creamy banana shake.  
This is a very nice triple.  Has a very subtle blend of hops and spice.  Just overall very well made and decent tasting.
Medium orange color - cloudy with a thin head.  Aroma of lemon, pine, oranges and a hint of yeast.  Chewy body, nice tripel-like flavor that is fruity, slightly alcoholic and dry.

33cl bottle from Noel Cuveliers.  Gold with lasting white head.  Belgian yeast aroma.  Good fruit.  Rose petal.  Decent tripel.  Its fine, quite distinguishable as a tripel.  I quite like it.  Some hop on finish is good and tangy.

Bottle:  Real big fruity aroma with apple, raisin, grape, light pepper, and a hint of alcohol.  Pours a hazy dark golden-orange with an off-white head with decent retention and excellent lacing.  Flavor of raisin, apple, orange peel, and yeast up front.  There a touch of toffee in the background.  The finish has slight flowery hops and spice with just the slightest touch of alcohol.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2007 bottle from bierodrome, kingsway. Things always taste better when theyre free and this was mighty tastey! Clear gold with dense white head. Aroma of banana nut bread and citrus fruits with notes of coriander and yeast. Taste is very crisp and light - the 8.5% is well hidden. Fruity with malts, spice and a slightly floral edge. Finish is intense with banana, spice and warming alcohol. Damn nice tripel.

6L bottle. The bottle was so big that we opened it and poured the beer into three pitchers. Pours a hazy yellow with a very large white rocky head that lasts and leaves good lacing. Aroma of citrus, sweet malt, and floral hops. Taste is citrusy and light with a slight residual sweetness complimented by a smooth bitterness and slight spiciness. Overall a great triple that doesnt have the typical banana ester profile which is a nice change of pace.
Excellent. Huge nutty, banana nose. This beer leaves the mouth, towards the stomach, and my palate wants more. Its good to be a belgian. This beer follows suit.
SImilar to St Feuillien Cuvée de Noël but lighter, golden yellow white head, fruity and floral, good tripel.

Pours very frothy. has a sweet aroma but very bland. Appearance is a nice golden brown. Mouthfeel is nice with a light aftertaste. Flavor is nice and malty. A very nice but average for a belgian tripple.

750 Bottle.  Snifter Glass.  Nice golden color with big off white head.  Aroma of sweet honey, yeast, and a little spice.  Taste is less fruity (mainly orange) than advertised but with sweet malt and spice.  Finnish is both acidic and mildly sweet.  The alcohol is well hidden.  Well balanced albeit less complex than some of the top triples.
Bottle from World of Beer Clearwater - virtually no head w/carbination - hoppy - floral spices - eventually smooth on the palate - not bad but not my favorite

From a bottle at Bon Vivant - Suffolk.  Clear and golden with almost no haziness, although Id have expected some.  Solid light fizzy head.  Acidic and an almost vinegary aroma.  Smoother palate than the aroma suggested ... sharply bitter at first ... buttery and tight.  Almost like a Witbier spiked with ethanol.  (#2731, 3/3/2007)

75 cl. bottle. Amber, nice head and lacing. the aroma has notes of coriander and fruit. The flavour is complex with notes of alcohol, fermented apple and a nice citrus to balance the sweetness. Its nice, but I prefer Maredsous, Triple Karmeliet or Westmalle.

Bottle.
Hazy golden coloured with a huge white head.
Aroma of fruits and spices with notes of yest and hops.
Flavour of fruits, spices and hops with notes of yeast.
Dry hoppy and yeasty finish.
thick head very crisp taste well carbination very fine triple easy drinking beer due to the floral aroma and all. i fucks wit this beer right here.
For a Tripel, its quite standard, which makes it plenty good for me.  I overrate this style by a good half-point or so on average, so the RateBeer average is about right on this.

Huge & foamy white head, cloudy & hazy dark golden color, fruity nose with notes of yeast, orange, coriander & a touch of alcohol, very smooth & drinkable, fairly light in body which makes this very dangerous, you can go through a bunch of these & wonder where they went, and then wonder why you feel the way you do, dense flavors with notes of raisin, coriander, pepper, orange & light hops, lingering finish & aftertaste that was very spicy with a touch of alcohol, very enjoyable, a great tripel

Beutifull golden appearance with a long lasting white creamy head. Fruity nose with hints of raisin and alcohol. Sparkling palate and a wellmade sweetness that balance out the alcohol. Well tasting long lasting finish, like a desert!

Draught at The Map Room.  Pours hazy dark yellow with a large off-white fizzy head, mostly lasting, good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, hay, straw), average hops (herbs, grass) and average yeast (barnyard, earth).  Full bodied, alcoholic texture, soft carbonation and an astringent finish.  Average duration, moderate sweetness and bitterness, heavy acidity.

Draft goblet at The Map Room, Chicago. Big golden pour with a bit of haze and a white thin pils head. Sweet tripel malt smell cuts through the damnable cigarette smoke in the room. Taste is almost too light, though. A nicely toasted light malt taste, slight bitterness. But the alcohol is hidden here. I know itll ambush me at some point, but I just couldnt pick it out.
Pours a bubbly gold.  Smells of fruit, clove, spices, etc.  It has a malty, spicy flavor combined with others that I cannot place.  A nice silky spicy finish.

At the 2007 Big Beer, Belgians, & Barleywines Festival in Vail. Pours orange with a fluffy white head that lasts and lasts. Perfume and floral hops to the aroma. Crisp palate of medium malt and some spiciness. More generous use of flavoring hops than I typically see in a belgian. Nice.
loved it.  it is, as advertised, very fruity.  retains its strength and smells heavenly.

Courtesy of santoslhalper. Aged two years. Spicy, herbal nose with witchhazel and heather, subdued hoppiness. Undefined herbs reminiscent of a natural cough drop. Lemongrass? Mild alcohol notes to this musky aroma. Golden amber clear with a bit of dregs haze, topped with thin off-white lacing head. Medium bodied, with light to medium carbonation. Starts with sweet malts, fruity with heavy herbal spicyness, some tastes which elude me. Mild bitterness at first in the finish, followed by light chalky yeast. A decent tripel with nice qualities after aging. Dry bitter fruit skins after. Would like to compare to fresh.
Orange colour good spice and fruity tast.average head.and a dry finish.Just a nother good tripel.

22 Jul 2006 - Light apricot, spiced, hoppy with some barnyard touches.  Light cloudy amber colour, good fluffy head and good suds lacing.  Luscious fruit and hop flavour.  Thick mouthfeel, tangy finish and lovely fruit hop balance.  This is one of my favourite tripels.

Pours golden with a fizzy and slightyl rocky white head. Candy sugar, apple/tropical fruit, and light doughy yeast aroma. Lots of fruit and peppery spice in the flavor, a small hint of licorice, light hop bitterness, and a bit of mint on the finish. Palate is light/medium, effervescent, dryer than expected, lightly alcoholic, slightly bitter, and a bit of lingering peppermint. Nicely balanced with such an interesting array of flavors. Certainly worth trying.

750ml bottle. Poured a medium golden color with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of spices and fruits (apples). Tastes of the same. I found both the aromas and tastes to be on the softer and muted side. I would have preferred them to be stronger.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 Sweet candy malt aroma with spices. Cloudy amber colour with good head and lacing. Malt sweet flavour with spice and hops. Smooth palate.

clear gold color with a large foamy white head.  tropical fruit aroma with yeast and maybe a hint of licorice.  flavor is bright and fruity.  candy-like with pepper and spices.    i keep tasting black necco wafers(licorice?)  by far the best st. feuillien.

Dark murky orange with a thick rocky head. Decent lacing. Nice refreshing transparant aroma of honey, sugar, hops and sweet flowers, without becoming unbalanced. Lush taste, drier than expected, very complex. Carbonation was heavy which kinda distracted from the flavor, but it made the brew very crisp & refreshing. A very good tripel.

750ml, sampled May 2001. Pours a bright white head that sits dutifully atop a hazy golden body that looks as if it contains an oily honey. Raucous sweet malt aroma escapes the confines of the glass, a prelude to a nose of alcohol, candy sugar, generous malts and peppery fruits. Flavor is much the same, now hops are showing thier face, along with some tart caramel. Alcohol is very warm but not offensive, meshing quite well with the spiciness and sweetness. Palate was medium to full and the body seemed very well rounded and expressive for this style. Finishes on the dry side with a lingering white pepper component. This example seems to have just enough bitterness from hops to compliment the other nuances, never detracting from the quaffability. Very tasty, never too sweet. Great triple, a classic.
Bottle. Golden colour with an average head. The aroma is yeasty, with a bit of fruits and little spices. The flavor is spicy, bit hopped, caramel, and bit dry in the finish.
Golden blonde color.  White foamy head.  aroma of spice and malts.  Flavor of sweet malt overpowered by hops.  Brilliant!

Bottled. Hazy, pale yellowish nutbrown colour with huge fluffy white head. Aroma is acidic fruits with some flowery hints. Flavour is stingingly spicy and also very acidic fruity. Quite dry finish, but not much aftertaste. An ok and quite clean tripel, but then again nothing that surprises either.
This amber ale pours with a nice white head, eliciting a flowery hop aroma. The flavor is fruity and spicy with a dry finish. This is a decent, but rather blase example of an abbey ale.

Bottle. White and astoshingly low head. Hazy yellow body. Aroma of hops and heavily dominated by alcohol. Acidic hops flavor with a lot of carbonation, probably in a not succeeded attempt to hide the alcohol.  I simply do not understand your high ratings. Is it: Oh my goodness its Belgian it must be good. Bullshit. (Heard somebody talking of a Belgian mafia).

Bottle, pours a golden amber colour with a deliciously large pillowy white head. Aroma is equally delicious, malty and spicy, with touches of yeast. Sharp and peppery on the palate, quite carbonated, but that works well offsetting the alcohol sweetness. Dry and sweet in a relatively short finish.
On tap. Hazy gold, thin white head. Aroma is plums, pears, malt, & spices. Flavor is fruity, malty, and slightly spicy. I can taste a faint hint of olives.

Faintly hazy gold with a large whtie head, but jsut so-so lace. Nose has a yeasty sourness to it, vollowed by a light touch of anise, and some spice notes - pretty nice al in all. On the palate there is a livley effervescence complementing a medium body and a pretty clean mouthfeel. Flavors of light stone fruit are balnced by a slight sourness and some spicy bitterness.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2007 Pours a hazy pale yellow with a substantial, white head. Medium sweetness. Quite dry with flavors of yeast, pepper, flowers and sugar. Medium bodied. Sharp dry finish with a floral touch.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2007 Sampled on draft at the Sharp Edge in Pittsburgh this beer poured a hazy bright golden color with a small white head. The aroma is sweet, sugary and fruity. The flavor is sweet, tangy and fruity with a sharp bitter middle and a long peppery and spicy finish. The alcohol is a bit noticeable. The mouthfeel is moderately thick. The middle bitterness fades as you get down the glass and the beer keeps getting a little fruitier and better as you go along.
Im just not a big fan of abbey ales and this one is no exception. Judging from other ratings its a good example of the style but not a favorite of mine.

Bottled (BB 10/2007).
Slightly hazy golden color, big foamy white head. Fruity, lightly woody hoppy and alcoholic aroma. Intensive bitterness. Super alcoholic with wood, yeast and banana. Long dry bitter aftertaste. Like that subtle fruityness combined with bitterness.
Light and clear gold.  Thick white head that lasts a few minutes. The aroma is very floral and fruity, with a definite alcohol hint.  Very wheaty, with a short finish.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Great crystal-clear orange pour.   i think one of the best aspects of this beer is its nose...fruity yeasts, citrus, bready maltiness, and honey(?).   the flavors are quite intense...yeast, fruitiness, pears, tangerines, belgian spiciness, and alcohol.   Pretty interesting.
Lot no. 139557.  Pours a bright gold into a tulip.  Frothy, bright white undulating micro head.  Lemon yeast aromas. Upfront sweet alcohol and caramel with a lasting sweet pepper finish.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Golden coloured beer with a huge white head. Aroma malty with some fruit notes. Flavor is spiced hops, with some fruit and floral notes. Balanced aftertaste. Heavy palate.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2006 Bottle. Cloudy yellow color with big chunks of yeast in there. Head was very impressive and long lasting. There was even lacing left in the glass after I finished this great Triple. Aroma was very yeasty, with a god mix of malt in there as well. The bouquet is very complex. In mouth the alcohol shines through when it is too cold. But at the right temperature it smoothes out nicely and the sweet notes take over the mouth feel. Some hoppy bitterness can also be felt. So it is surprisingly dry and hoppy for a triple. The alleged three times fermenting really gives this triple power, and some champagne like taste and feel. Full bodied and very complex. Finish is balanced and long lasting.
MMmm...oh well it was a very nice beer with a special spicey flavor (or maybe the same shrimps that AmazonMatt had). Nice crown, nice orangy color.

A great beer. Strong malt backbone with an interesting medley of flavors, including strong yeast flavors and a spicey hops, or was that the spicey shrimp that I ate along side this. My first Abbey Tripel, I sure would like another to linger over, in the appropriate glassware. Special thanks to my wife Peggy for bringing this beer down from Atlanta.

This beer tastes a lot more wild and dynamic than other tripels Ive had.  Its not unbalanced, just unpredicatable. Lots of yeast, a little sweetness, powerful flavors here.  Thick meringue-like head over straw colored liquid.
Aroma: sweet malt, light candy and some fern greenery. Appearance: cloudy orange/brown with a fluffy white head. Flavour: malty, aniseed, grainy/seedy. Palate: carbonated and a medium mouthfeel.
Beautiful spicy aroma. Nice appearance with huge lasting, creamy head. sweet, fruity taste with lots of layers. Nice aftertaste. Superb beer which somehow IMHO has gained an everyday, ordinary image.
Pours clear yellow with nice white creamy head. Aroma of buscuits, apples and sweet malts. Taste is sweet as well, quite vinious, much fruitiness, and quite sweet.
Bottle. Pours light golden with high/very fluffy and stable white head. Taste is complex, with notes of spices, fruits and malts. Rather strong notes of pepper in the aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2007 2003 Bottle:  This was like drinking two beers, one when we first poured it and another twenty minutes later after it came to room temperature.  It poured a transparent gold with a fluffy head.  At first, the nose was a bit subdued, noting only peaches and day old bread.  Almost flat.  The body was slightly sweet and doughy.  As time passed, a great kettle corn, caramel and toffe note took over and this beer REALLY opened up.  Notes of candy corn, lemon herb and fresh dough filled both my nose and mouth.  The lush carbonation was a perfect match to the airy, sweet body.  Really fantastic and drinkable.  Thanks Jeff!

I have been listening to all of the podcasts about beer and they are always raving about Belgian beer but I just dont get it.  Tripel is my least favorite and I find it just too malty, with an almost whiskey like character (tastes similar to me as some Knob Creek in a couple of ice cubes).  Of course this one is MILES better than the New Belgium tripel but it cost five times as much!

Not that it matters but I love the label on this bottle.

750mL, no date.  Pours a clear golden with a  large white head.  Theres caramel malts and then theres caramel--this has a strong aroma of caramel.  There is also some yeasty dough, dust, pepper, bananas, fairly spicy.  Dough and peppery up front, lots of fruit, alcohol present. Mild bitterness.   Spicy, dry finish.  Full bodied, high carbonation.  Quite good.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Dominant yeasty aroma - feels like a witbier. Flavour is sweetish and spicy - again a lot like a wit, but far stronger. 11-07-06.
Golden amberin color with a thick creamy white head. Sour soapy citrus smell with hint of fruit. Sour alcohol tingle copper citrus finish.
pours a hazy yellow with a nice big head. aroma of fruits and light spices. sweet flavor of banana, malt and a bit of lemon
Very complete beer and some complexity. Fruity aromas. Can tell it is 8.5%. Very mature beer. its a candy drink!

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2009 Bottle at bistro lautre oeil. Pours a pale amber colour with a long lasting medium head. Aroma is pretty sweet, with caramel and maltiness. Flavour is spices, yeast, caramel and malts with a bitter aftertaste. Medium to full body.
Hazy amber color with soicy smell. Tastes mildly sweet with spicey flavor. corriander and belgian sugar taste upfront with simi yeasty aftertaste.
"Poued a light peach color huge fluffy head which left great lacing. Aroma was of light fruits and spices. Flavor was the same little tartness and yeast to it. SOlid beer. nice triple"

Draft at Coles in Buffalo, NY alongside IPFreely and Rudolph. Poured golden with a nice white creamy head. Aroma of yeast, fruity esters, and some alcohol. Nice clean medium mouthfeel and carbonation. Flavor was sweet, fruity, with notes of lemon. Mild bitter and spicy finish. Very easy to drink, but I was rather buzzed when I had this. I think this was the beer that gave me the hangover and caused me to sleep in my clothes.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2007 750 bottle. Beer is a clear light/medium gold color with a larger-than-average, off-white, frothy, mostly diminishing head.

The aroma is malty with a light note to toasted grain, light note of biscuit; Hoppy with moderate notes of resin/pine, evergreen-tinted herbals; Yeasty with a moderate note of dank basement, light doughy suggestion; Moderate note of alcohol, trace notes of banana/clove.

The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly/moderately bitter, lightly acidic with a long, moderately warm, moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic/dry finish.

The body is light/medium, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively/fizzy.

Lean, lovelyish rendition.

On tap at Ortinos Northside.  Pours a hazy golden orange with a smaller white head that left minimal lacing.  Aroma of spices, orange and yeast.  Flavor of yeast, citrus, clove, banana, peppery and various other spices.
Post-mondial Tasting. Belle blonde, bon collet qui dure. Arome dépice sucré plaisant. Goût trop faible pour un triple.

Clear golden brew. Nice head, lots of laces. Strong aroma of orange, some pepper in the nose as well as an herb I cannot identifiy (coriander?). Extremely well balanced. To my opinion, its main interest is you can never tell wether it is more sweet or bitter. Flavor is of citrus and powdered sugar (sucre en poudre) and a bitterness of orange peels. Round mouthfeel, easildy drinkable. Very nice tripel.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2009 In short: A tasty and crisp tripel with an intense dry noble hopping.  One of the best tripel out there.  Underrated.
How: Bottle 750ml/330 many times.  This re-write for a fresh (about 6 months) 750ml bottle.
The look: Partly cloudy golden body topped by medium white head leaving good lacing
In long: Nose is fruity, grassy and spicy.  A rather complex taste.  Main attractions are the fruity yeast (not focussing on any particular fruit), nice mix of spices (again with a lot more than just the usual coriander) and a whole lot of dry noble hops.  Just citrusy enough to give it a pleasant refreshing tartness.  Body feels full rich and crisp at the same time.  Finish is very sharp (almost aggressive) and dry.  With some age on it the finish becomes less sharp/dry and the fruity flavours take more room.  I prefer fresh.  9% abv very well hidden.  One of the best Tripel out there.  I buy these this beer in large quanitities.  Even bought a full 24 not so long ago.  And when its all gone it leaves a hole in my heart almost as big as the one in my wallet.
Hazy gold, heavy and resiny. Finishes quite bitterly. Smells like a tree. Girlfriend couldnt finish it. Run-of- the-mill elephant tranquilizer.

No date. Clear gold with a modest, fizzy white head. A single side of the glass is filled with bubbles moving very quickly from bottom to top, the rest of the glass is clear. Nose is rich, sweet, malty. Light fruits, hops, and yeast also. Same flavors, a bit of musty funk, yeast adds some spicy and doughy notes, herbs and alcohol in there, also. Full, balanced body. Great tripel.

Bouteille de 330 ml ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur fruité (Poires entre autre). Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun énorme col mousseux sculpté et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel et dépices. Courte durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Forte effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de caramel et dalcool en arrière goût. (Rating #473)

UPDATED: APR 26, 2008 Draught.  At Coles, Buffalo NY.  Poured pale clear slightly bubbly gold (got hazier as it warmed) with a smallish white creamy head.  Pleasant fruit/spice/alcohol/yeast light bitter hops aroma, the taste was quite similar although very smooth with a surprisingly spicy bitter lemon zest medium-long finish.  Average body, quite sticky, decently carbonated, subtle and nicely complex - a very good and easy-drinking tripel which I think I might rate higher from the bottle - just a guess.  ** Original rating 7/3/8/4/15 --- re-rated April 18 2008 - much, much better, complex, tasty, smelled great.

Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours golden/orange with a fat white head, very smooth tasting with a little bite upfront, smooth like silk on the way down. great sweet taste, i loved this beer, very drinkable.
Gold blond colour, average white head. Malty and fruity aroma. Full body, rather bitter finish with a light fruity ending.

(Bottle) Pours light golden with high/very fluffy and stable white head. Taste is extremely complex, with notes of spices/fruits and malts. Rather strong notes of pepper in the aftertaste. High ABV% yet the beer is easy drinkable and refreshing. Very good!
Clear yellow with a medium lasting white head. Weak, fruity aroma with banana, citrus, pineapple. Excellent, well-balanced flavour, with pepper and acidic fruitiness. Quite refreshing and clean.

I had this as part of the beer/cheese paring at the Brick Store Pub on 04/03/06.  It was paired with Abbaye de Belloc.  This was the 3rd pairing of 5.  The beer was poured from a 11.2 ounce bottle into a mini-tulip glass.  The beer was a partly cloudy light gold color.  It had a nice head to start, but it faded away quickly.  The aroma was mild and fruity.  The taste was slightly sweet up front with a nice hop kick near the end.  The finish was very crisp.

I almost subtracted points for the difficulty I had in getting the cork out of the bottle, but forgave St-Feuillien once I got a whiff of the beer.  Soft sweet malts are covered by a yeasty fruitiness (pears, bananas, cherries), a light spicing, and some gentle floral hop scents.  The taste is full of the fruits and a pleasant blending of spice flavors, ginseng, white peppers, chamomille... and theres some malty sweetness as well.  Nice mildly bitter, dry finish.  An ale well worth drinking again.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>

Brown bottle, 33 cl, expiry date: 1/11/06; eye: orangey with citrusy yellow reflections, nice white head that slowly disappears, average effervescence, hazy; nose: yeast appears has bready, while hops presents itself in its grassy tux, citrusy; mouth: acidic and citric beginning, followed by a hint of sweetness and then a hint of alcohol and of slight bitterness, oily texture in its finale

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 33 cl, date dexpiration : 11/11/06; oeil : orangé avec des reflets citron, belle mousse blanche qui disparaît tranquillement, effervescence moyenne, voilée; nez : levure sous forme de pain, houblon sous forme dherbe, citrique; bouche : début acidique, citrique, suivi dune pointe de sucré, dune pointe dalcool, dun amertume léger, texture huileuse en finale

Pours a clearish-golden (clouding late) with a column of quick & intense effervescence and topped by a souffle of rocky egg whites. Aroma is dry & yeasty with light banana and pepper. Fluffy and bittersweet, banana and spice flavor. Very dry & velvety, soft yet flavorful.
